meanings.definition: Relating to or based on phenomena
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a phenomenological study to understand the natural events.
meanings.sent2: Her phenomenological approach to the research focused on observable occurrences.
meanings.sent3: The phenomenological explanation of the magic trick made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's eyes, the changing seasons were a phenomenological dance of colors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a phenomenological example to make the concept clear to the students.

meanings.sent1: The book provided a phenomenological analysis of the mysterious lights in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The phenomenological report detailed the behavior of the animals in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The phenomenological description of the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a phenomenological gaze, taking in every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The phenomenological study shed light on the unexplained occurrences in the area.

meanings.sent1: The phenomenological approach to psychology focused on observable behaviors.
meanings.sent2: His phenomenological research delved into the patterns of human interaction.
meanings.sent3: The phenomenological perspective on the weather forecast was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The phenomenological view of the universe revealed its intricate workings.
meanings.sent5: The phenomenological study of nature captivated the curious minds of the students.
